metaData.descriptionCS: The examinee reads passages aloud or silently. After each passage, the examinee orally responds to literal and inferential comprehension questions that are read aloud by the examiner.

questions.title: The Frog: Item 1
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What color was the frog?

questions.title: The Frog: Item 2
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What scared the frog?

answers.text: (It saw) someone / me / the boy / the girl

questions.title: The Frog: Item 3
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Where did the frog hide?

answers.text: Under / Next to / By a tree

questions.title: The Frog: Item 4
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What time of day is it in this story?

questions.title: Pet Day: Item 5
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Which animals can students bring to school on Pet Day?

questions.title: Pet Day: Item 6
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Amy brought her bird to school on Pet Day. She walked into the classroom with the bird on her finger. Which rule did Amy not follow?

answers.text: She can't have the bird on her finger
(Pets / The bird) must be in a cage

questions.title: Pet Day: Item 7
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Richard wants to win the prize on Pet Day. What must happen for Richard to win?

answers.text: He must follow the rules (e.g., bring one pet; use a leash)
His pet must be (voted) the best

questions.title: Pet Day: Item 8
questions.topInstructionsHTML: On Pet Day, Joe brought his three cats to school in a cage. Which rule did Joe not follow?

answers.text: Only one pet / cat is allowed
Three pets / cats are not allowed

questions.title: Pet Day: Item 9
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Martin brought his cat in a cage. Jeff carried his cat in his arms. Which person did not follow the rules?

answers.text: The one who carried the cat / pet

questions.title: Pet Day: Item 10
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Lauren has a rabbit, a puppy, and a goldfish. Which pet is she allowed to bring on Pet Day?

questions.title: Baobab Tree: Item 11
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what type of land does the Baobab tree grow?

questions.title: Baobab Tree: Item 12
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What does the story say makes the Baobab tree a funny- or unusual-looking tree?

answers.text: Looks like it’s growing upside down

questions.title: Baobab Tree: Item 13
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What are two ways that people use the Baobab tree?

answerGroups.answerGroupLabel: Refers to one of the following Q:

scoreList.label: Refers to one of the following Q:

questions.title: Baobab Tree: Item 14
questions.topInstructionsHTML: When does the tree get leaves?

questions.title: Baobab Tree: Item 15
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What causes the Baobab tree to become hollow on the inside?

answers.text: Elephants dig holes in the tree / chew the wood

questions.title: Baobab Tree: Item 16
questions.topInstructionsHTML: How long can the Baobab tree live?

questions.title: Baobab Tree: Item 17
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Why do elephants dig holes in the tree?

questions.title: Baobab Tree: Item 18
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Which part of the Baobab tree does the story say people use?

questions.title: Tidy Tamiko: Item 19
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What does the story say Tamiko liked to do?

questions.title: Tidy Tamiko: Item 20
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What was the last thing Tamiko did before she went to Toko Town?

questions.title: Tidy Tamiko: Item 21
questions.topInstructionsHTML: How did Tamiko get to the stars?

questions.title: Tidy Tamiko: Item 22
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Why are the stars brighter now than ever before?

answers.text: Tamiko cleaned / polished the stars / them

questions.title: Tidy Tamiko: Item 23
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Which part of the story could not have happened in real life?

answers.text: The moon had a familiar smile
Getting carried into the sky by the wind
Washing the dog until it’s bald

questions.title: Tidy Tamiko: Item 24
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Why do people say the moon’s smile is familiar?

answers.text: Tamiko is up there / in the sky / on the moon
It looks like Tamiko / Tamiko’s smile

questions.title: Good Neighbors: Item 25
questions.topInstructionsHTML: In what country does the story take place?

questions.title: Good Neighbors: Item 26
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What did the man want?

answers.text: To live by a large mountain

questions.title: Good Neighbors: Item 27
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What made the dragon’s lake larger?

answers.text: Putting mud / rocks on the mountain
Carrying mud / rocks up the hill / mountain
Carrying away mud / rocks (from the lake)

questions.title: Good Neighbors: Item 28
questions.topInstructionsHTML: How did the dragon and the man help each other?

answerGroups.answersExplanation: The dragon helped the man make a larger mountain
The man helped the dragon make a larger lake

questions.title: Good Neighbors: Item 29
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Which part of the story shows that the dragon and the man worked hard to finish the job quickly?

answers.text: They went up and down the mountain
They often worked in the rain

questions.title: Good Neighbors: Item 30
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Why did the dragon thank the man?

answers.text: The dragon got a bigger lake
For helping create a larger lake

questions.title: Good Neighbors: Item 31
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What important lesson could be learned from this story?

answers.text: Refers to friendship or helping (e.g., You should help people / be friendly)
Refers to the rewards / mutual benefit of cooperation (e.g., If you help someone, you will get something too)

questions.topInstructionsHTML: Why does the Ollie Owl shirt cost more than the other two shirts?

questions.title: Toontime Tees: Item 37
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What other information would someone need to know in order to purchase one of these shirts?

answers.text: Refers to any relevant purchasing information (e.g., Where to buy; How to order; Contact information)

questions.title: Science Fun: Item 38
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Besides colorful, which word best describes Gobbledeeglue?

answers.text: Refers to any of the following (or similar) words: Bouncy; Stretchy; Gooey; Rubbery

questions.title: Science Fun: Item 39
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What three ingredients must you have to make Gobbledeeglue?

questions.title: Science Fun: Item 40
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Why must you do steps 1 and 2 before you do step 3?

answers.text: The glue and borax must dissolve (before step 3)
The glue and borax must each be mixed with water (before step 3)

questions.title: Science Fun: Item 41
questions.topInstructionsHTML: How does step 4 change the Gobbledeeglue?

questions.title: Science Fun: Item 42
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What is the next step after stirring in the food coloring?

answerGroups.answerGroupLabel: Refers to one of the following Q:

answerGroups.answersExplanation: Leave it alone / Wait (for three minutes)

scoreList.label: Refers to one of the following Q:

questions.title: Science Fun: Item 43
questions.topInstructionsHTML: How long do you have to mix the borax and water with the glue and water?

questions.title: Science Fun: Item 44
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What do you predict would happen if you skipped step 5?

answers.text: You could not pick it up

questions.title: Science Fun: Item 45
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Which words in the passage say it is okay to touch Gobbledeeglue with your bare hands?

answers.text: Refers to any of the following directions: Pick it up; Set it down; Roll it

questions.title: How California Came to Be: Item 47

answers.text: He saw a huge turtle (swim by)

answers.text: Put his fingers into the soil

questions.title: How California Came to Be: Item 50

answers.text: They were tired of staying in the same place

questions.title: How California Came to Be: Item 51
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Why couldn’t the Turtle Brothers move away from each other?

answers.text: The weight of the land (on their backs)

He doesn’t want to chase his father’s dream
His goals / desires differ from his father’s

questions.title: The Rock: Item 81
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What suddenly made this hike so difficult?

questions.topInstructionsHTML: What was the most important thing the women had to overcome in order to scale the rock?

questions.title: The Rock: Item 83
questions.topInstructionsHTML: What kept the women from turning back when they saw the 20-foot cliff above them?

answers.text: They had already come so far
They had already hiked 5 miles / 6,000 feet
They were determined to keep going / refused to surrender

questions.title: The Rock: Item 84
questions.topInstructionsHTML: Near the end of the climb, why did Angela refuse to check on Sherry’s progress?

answers.text: She didn’t want to look down / fall
She realized there was only 5 feet to go
She didn’t want to get discouraged
Angela needed to stay focused (on herself)
Angela needed to get herself to the top
